node.title: Aussies highlight positives from poor T20 World Cup build-up after reaching final
node.description: Australia lost five consecutive T20 series prior to the men's World Cup, but coach Justin Langer believes the experience ultimately benefited his squad.
node.content:
["Australia coach Justin Langer says his squad's\u00a0poor build-up to the men's T20 World Cup actually benefited them by developing greater depth.", "The Australians \u2014 who have never won a men's T20 World Cup \u2014 were not tipped to figure prominently at the showpiece event in United Arab Emirates and Oman on the back of losing five consecutive Twenty20 series.", "Those losses included series\u00a0in West Indies and Bangladesh where Australia\u00a0fielded depleted squads as several frontline players sat out.", "But Australia has qualified for the\u00a0men's T20 World Cup final, with New Zealand its opponent\u00a0in Dubai on Monday morning (AEDT).", "A win over Pakistan in the second semi-final saw Australia move through.", "", "
Australia progressed to the tournament\u00a0after beating Pakistan in their semi-final.(Getty/ICC: Gareth Copley)
", "Langer said improving the depth of his squad was a positive to come out of the disappointing results against West Indies and Bangladesh.", "\"There was reason why our form on the surface wasn't as we would have liked,\" Langer told a media conference on Friday.", "\"We had a lot of great faith in the squad, a lot of great faith in the preparation we had. The tours to West Indies and Bangladesh \u2026 were\u00a0brilliant for the depth of our squad and for Australian cricket.\"", "Langer said fast bowler Josh Hazlewood got invaluable match practice on the tours, while all-rounder Mitchell Marsh used them to break into the World Cup squad and has since been a key player for Australia.", "\"It's more fun winning than losing, I promise, but in the big scheme of things, it's about this World Cup tournament;\u00a0so far, the pieces of the puzzle are fitting together quite nicely,\" he said.", "Sunday's clash will be a rematch of the final of the 2015 ODI World Cup, which Australia comprehensively won on home soil.", "ABC/Reuters"]
